caseTitle: MISCELLANY-AT-LAW TRIBUTE TO THE LATE MRS JANET DANIELS, FIR
summary: This document is a memorial tribute to Mrs Janet Daniels, the first Editor of the Review of Ghana Law and a key figure in Ghana's legal publishing landscape. She served for sixteen years in the Council for Law Reporting and was instrumental in shaping both the Ghana Law Reports and the Review of Ghana Law. Appointed Assistant Editor of the Ghana Law Reports in 1965 and first Editor of the Review in 1969, she elevated the journal's national and international standing. Her work enabled critical legal analysis and contributed significantly to the development of Ghanaian jurisprudence. Tributes highlight her professionalism, editorial rigor, and original contributions to legal discourse, including articles on statute law, trial by jury, and defamation. She retired in 1980 and passed away on 20 January 1991.
rationaleHighlights: Mrs Janet Daniels made significant contributions to Ghanaian legal scholarship through her editorial work
She was instrumental in establishing the Review of Ghana Law as a premier law journal
Her high editorial standards ensured quality legal publications
She contributed original articles on key legal topics in Ghana
confidenceNotes: The document is a tribute rather than a judicial decision, so standard legal case elements like verdict and winning side are not applicable. Information is derived directly from the tribute text.
